content.description:
A less than vertical jaunt up cobbles and possibly loose flake features.

Start up left of a crack.
content.protection: 7 lead bolts to two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Right hand route on the oblong mini wall sandwiched between two corner cracks.  Right of Grandma Woke Up Dead.

Furthest routes up the hlll at the Cinema Wall.

content.description:
A shorter route on a less than vertical rock.

Start just right of a foliage filled corner.  Head up, slap your granny.
content.protection: 6 lead bolts to a two bolt anchor.

content.description:
A long single pitch up vertical cobbles.

A steep start at an overhang down low jump starts the anticipation.  Big holds and ok feet lead to lower angle rock.

The route travels up the wall through three shallow horizontal half pipes features.

Finish at a three bolt anchor.

There is a mid-ish point anchor on the right which would work if a shorter rope is employed and the pitch needs to be rappelled twice.  Due to loose rock, this anchor is not recommended to break the route into two pitches.

Take care on this long route.  Tie in both the climber and the belayer at the rope ends.  Do not lower someone unless the bottom end of the rope is secure (belayer/lower should tie in!).
content.protection: 19 lead bolts and a three bolt anchor.  Pool your draws!
content.location: To the right of the upper most routes and on the left side of a flat, unbroken wall.
